title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 March 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:06 <npm> has quit  
00:15 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
00:15 <@cjd> sdumitriu: pong  
00:16 <@sdumitriu> Nevermind  
00:17 <Qbert00> has quit  
00:31 <vmassol> has quit  
00:33 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:14 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:16 <faryshta> I tried to send a GSoC idea to the devs mail list but my mail got rejected. Where should I send it?  
01:16 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:16 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
01:18 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:19 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
01:26 <faryshta> sdumitriu, hi.  
01:42 <tekzilla> has quit  
01:46 <@sdumitriu> Hi faryshta  
01:46 <@sdumitriu> You have to subscribe to the devs list before you can send emails to it  
02:15 <faryshta> sdumitriu, how can I do that?  
04:03 <faryshta> has quit  
04:13 <DrLou\_> has quit  
06:46 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I've made progress on PostgreSQL migrations  
07:41 <@sdumitriu> But I'm not sure you'll like the solution  
08:02 <vmassol> sdumitriu: good morning. what's the solution?  
08:02 <vmassol> is oracle the same issue as with postgres?  
08:03 <@sdumitriu> I don't know yet, I still didn't manage to install an oracle database locally  
08:03 <vmassol> why don't you use a VM?  
08:03 <@sdumitriu> I'll look at it after I finish with PG  
08:03 <vmassol> http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/databaseappdev-vm-161299.html  
08:03 <vmassol> (these VMS work on virtualbox)  
08:04 <@sdumitriu> The problem is in the way the connector deals with clobs versus varchar  
08:04 <vmassol> connector = ?  
08:04 <vmassol> driver?  
08:04 <@sdumitriu> JDBC  
08:04 <vmassol> ok driver then  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> MySQL and HSQL accept either type wherever a "String" type is expected  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> That is why switching from varchar to clob didn't pose any problem with those  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> But in Postgres, if it expects a LOB, then it will fail if it doesn't get one  
08:06 <@sdumitriu> Hibernate can't change the type of existing columns  
08:06 <vmassol> migration?  
08:06 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
08:06 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
08:06 <vmassol> sounds good, why not?  
08:07 <@sdumitriu> In 3.3 some columns changed their type, so instead of being inline text (like varchar), they are lobs stored outside the main table data  
08:07 <vmassol> ah you want to port liquibase on 3.5 branch? Otherwise we can do it the old way there but it requires to write 2 migations I guess  
08:07 <@sdumitriu> Well, the script is rather complex, it has a lot of SQL in it  
08:07 <@sdumitriu> So there are three solutions  
08:07 <vmassol> (trying to figure out what I won't like ;))  
08:08 <@sdumitriu> Indeed, port Liquibase to 3.5 and write a script in it  
08:08 <@sdumitriu> 2 is to write a migrator full of SQL that is only triggered on Postgres  
08:08 <@sdumitriu> So the fact that it isn't very portable doesn't matter  
08:08 <@sdumitriu> It's targeted for one RDMBS only  
08:08 <vmassol> (and maybe oracle too)  
08:09 <@sdumitriu> Yes, Oracle too  
08:09 <@sdumitriu> But I guess it would look different, so another migrator for it  
08:09 <vmassol> (which reminds me I need to send today a proposal on supported DBs)  
08:09 <@sdumitriu> 3 is to just write an external script and tell users to run it if they want to upgrade from pre-3.3 to something new  
08:10 <vmassol> how is 3 simpler to write for us?  
08:10 <@sdumitriu> It's easier to maintain  
08:10 <vmassol> 1 and 2 look better since it's "automatic" and xwiki-based  
08:10 <vmassol> I mean our migrators are done for that  
08:10 <@sdumitriu> If it's written in the platform itself, we can't ship a newer version of the script to older versions of XWiki  
08:11 <vmassol> hmm  
08:11 <vmassol> we can force a migrator  
08:11 <vmassol> so we can document it  
08:11 <vmassol> and ask users who've already migrated to force to run it  
08:11 <@sdumitriu> If it's external, it's going to be hard to let users install versions that don't provide this migrator, like 3.4  
08:11 <vmassol> OR  
08:11 <@sdumitriu> Wrong  
08:12 <vmassol> even better  
08:12 <@sdumitriu> If it's internal, it's going to be hard to let users install versions that don't provide this migrator, like 3.4  
08:12 <vmassol> this migrator can run against the latest DB version  
08:12 <vmassol> and check if it needs to run  
08:12 <vmassol> so the users just need to upgrade to the latest 3.5.x or 4.x  
08:12 <@sdumitriu> It's not a question of whether the migrator should or should not run  
08:13 <@sdumitriu> It's the fact that we're forcing users to use the most recent version if they want the right migrator  
08:13 <vmassol> that sounds ok to me  
08:13 <vmassol> + we get them to migrate which is great :)  
08:13 <@sdumitriu> Since migrators are bound to the platform version  
08:13 <vmassol> (we don't want them on oldish versions)  
08:13 <vmassol> (as much as possible)  
08:13 <@sdumitriu> Yeah, only that it doesn't work like this with colossal clients  
08:14 <vmassol> ok we can ask about that  
08:14 <@sdumitriu> An upgrade takes months  
08:14 <vmassol> sure but if their wiki doesn't work  
08:14 <vmassol> they won't care  
08:14 <vmassol> they'll be ok with it I'm pretty sure  
08:14 <@sdumitriu> If they want to migrate to 4.0, they should have started this decision last summer  
08:14 <vmassol> ok what I can do is check with Ludovic since I'm going to the XWiki SAS office otday  
08:15 <@sdumitriu> Anyway, both the script and the migrator are going to use the same code  
08:15 <vmassol> yep  
08:15 <@sdumitriu> So we can do both  
08:15 <vmassol> was going to say that  
08:15 <@sdumitriu> Write the code in a migrator, and put the script somewhere on xwiki.rog  
08:15 <vmassol> sounds good  
08:16 <@sdumitriu> There's another problem with Postgres, the one with accented chars and history  
08:16 <@sdumitriu> Indeed, it seems that the materialized\_clob only works with ASCII chars, so we should switch to materialized\_blob instead  
08:17 <vmassol> for all DBs?  
08:17 <@sdumitriu> I don't know...  
08:17 <@sdumitriu> I'm wondering if there's any benefit in clobs that blobs don't have  
08:18 <vmassol> I don't need, we need to read up on this  
08:18 <vmassol> s/need/know/  
08:18 <@sdumitriu> We don't do anything with that text at the database level  
08:18 <@sdumitriu> It makes sense to use clobs when you want to use some text functions on that data  
08:19 <@sdumitriu> If we just want to store and retrieve text, then a blob would do just fine  
08:19 <vmassol> yeah I guess for full text search in the DB for ex a Blob wouldn't do  
08:19 <@sdumitriu> Exactly  
08:19 <vmassol> (we're not using that right now though since we're using lucene)  
08:20 <@sdumitriu> So, the question is, do we want full text search on stuff like the versioning diffs, attachment content, class xml?  
08:20 <cjd> has quit  
08:21 <@sdumitriu> Even if we would allow that, it's still going to be horribly slow  
08:21 <vmassol> I think we (you) should read up a bit more on pros/cons of BLOB vs CLOB with various DBs when using hibernate  
08:21 <vmassol> and send a proposal to the list  
08:21 <@sdumitriu> OK  
08:21 <@sdumitriu> Going to sleep now  
08:21 <vmassol> ok thanks  
08:21 <vmassol> going to catch a train  
08:22 <vmassol> (I'm in luxembourg)  
08:22 <vmassol> good night  
08:25 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <+florinciu> sdumitriu: Hi. While it's hard to make an upgrade under 2-3 weeks(including client validation), no upgrade should take months.  
08:26 <+florinciu> if it takes this longs maybe it's because it brings new custom features, otherwise something went wrong and the upgrade wan't handled properly.  
08:27 <@sdumitriu> It's not the technical process itself that takes long, it's the bureaucracy  
08:28 <@sdumitriu> Hi florinciu, hope you're doing well  
08:31 <+florinciu> yes, all is fine :)  
08:31 <+florinciu> I agree it's the bureaucracy. I've been there. :)  
08:32 <+florinciu> I'm just saying that even large upgrades shoud be pushed to average at a few weeks or 1-2 months max, not 6 months or so. :)  
08:35 <vmassol> has quit  
08:42 <abusenius> has quit  
08:49 <rrodriguez> has quit

10:02 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> has quit  
10:14 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <+sburjan> Hello. Do we have somewhere documented all the parameters and the order of them which start\_xwiki.bat can "eat" ? I don't find anything on documentation  
10:19 <+florinciu> sburjan: I think you can pass any valid java options to it. not sure about xwiki specific params  
10:20 <+sburjan> I have an issue on Windows, but not on Linux  
10:20 <+sburjan> start\_xwiki.sh 8080 6789 works  
10:20 <+sburjan> but on windows, using start\_xwiki.bat 8080 6789 gives me an error, class '6789' not found.  
10:21 <+sburjan> so bash has another way of interpreting parameters, which isn't exactly the same as windows' cmd  
10:22 <+florinciu> hmm, the bat doesn't seem to assign the JETTY\_STOPPORT (-DSTOP.PORT)  
10:22 <+sburjan> yes  
10:23 <+sburjan> but I see there 9 params, and I don't know which is which :)  
10:24 <+florinciu> on the .bat the second param is just a java option, while on the .sh there second param is always the stop port  
10:25 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <+florinciu> the scripts are inconsistent. i think you need to modify the .bat to behave like the .sh  
10:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I think the sh and the bat don't take the same parameters actually, we added some stuff in the sh at one point and not in the bat file if I remember well  
10:25 <+sburjan> yes  
10:25 <+florinciu> the other params are just basic java options  
10:26 <+sburjan> All I can say now is that if you want to start xwiki with custom port for listening and custom port for JETTY\_STOPPORT you can't (using the vanilla .bat file)  
10:38 <CIA-120> Eduard Moraru feature-user-profile-information-editor \* r5d32891 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5d3289171e2bce66d415529e2eda0b22f0fedf59 / (4 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7626: Allow customization of the user profile ...  
10:47 <silviar> has quit  
10:51 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <+sburjan> ok, it seems that our bat file doesn't take in account any params. so start\_xwiki.bat 6666 will still start it on 8080  
10:56 <+sburjan> creating a issue on this  
10:59 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <+sburjan> tmortagne: is this what you're saying about ? https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e6cfc8fa527cd05d93390533d9fbb6e07d1cc3b6#diff-1 I see this has been done only for the .sh file. So this might be the cause .bat doesn't work ?  
11:12 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
11:22 <nIMBVS> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <CIA-120> Eduard Moraru feature-annotations-merged-with-comments \* rbedaa64 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/bedaa6426e428ea4d2da987327d4ac014449fe91 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R40001XWIKI7540DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7540: Merge Annotations with Comments. ...  
11:27 <CIA-120> Eduard Moraru feature-annotations-merged-with-comments \* r3c248c9 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/3c248c9abf05ab6ded52ed9448cffe4fd0729319 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R40001XWIKI7540DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7540: Merge Annotations with Comments. ...  
11:28 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yep that's the one I remember  
11:30 <+tmortagne> you can probably do something similar for the .bat  
11:30 <+sburjan> tmortagne: ok, I am trying to get the same behavior for the .bat file too  
11:40 <+sburjan> tmortagne: my only question is: is it a valid usecase to have the same behavior for bat as for sh ? By behavior I mean the first 2 params to be start\_port and stop\_port ?  
11:42 <+tmortagne> sburjan: if want to execute the integration tests on windows yes we need both  
11:42 <+tmortagne> I added it to the sh mostly for tests  
11:42 <+sburjan> yes, I need it exactly for this :) preparing our windows integration for ui-tests  
11:42 <+tmortagne> clustering tests where you need several instances of XWiki running  
11:43 <+sburjan> ok, so it's valid. thanks. creating issue + patch  
11:43 <+tmortagne> and anyway I was lazy, we need to have the same parameters in both sh and bat  
11:43 <+tmortagne> at least for consistency  
11:43 <+sburjan> ok, gonna make them consistent  
11:43 <+tmortagne> thanks

15:51 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Actually switching from clob to blob isn't that easy  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> What fixes the encoding issue is this line:  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> <typedef name="materialized\_clob" class="org.hibernate.type.StringClobType" />  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> It's already used for Oracle, it looks like it's needed for postgres as well  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> It  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> It's time to add a separate mapping file for PostgreSQL as well...  
15:54 <jvdrean> has quit  
15:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: strange  
15:55 <vmassol> I was pretty sure I had added it for postgres  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> Yes, in the release notes  
15:55 <vmassol> but I probably wanted to do it or did it but didn't commit it  
15:55 <vmassol> hmm yes I must have forgotten to commit it then  
15:55 <vmassol> otp

19:13 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
19:13 <@sdumitriu> Pong  
19:15 <+mflorea> on the Add Extension UI, on the search bar, there is "Advanced install>>". I'd like to replace that with "Advance search>>" in order to have a single way to install extensions. I see that this is already supported in the code (i.e. just renaming the name of the submit button makes the form act like a search and then you can install the extension). I guess you didn't had the time to finish it  
19:16 <vishnu\_> has joined #xwiki  
19:17 <vishnu> has quit  
19:20 <@sdumitriu> IIRC, it used to be search initially  
19:20 <@sdumitriu> But maybe I remember it wrong  
19:20 <+tmortagne> yep but since it was ending up in install and not in a search result UI I changed it
